result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany Lynn Stripling

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.

8:53 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brittany Lynn Stripling in court in custody. INCLUDES 22CF359 (PSC) and 22CF559 (INIT). 22CF559: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waives prelim time limits. Court sets bond. Atty. Erdman requests PH. 22CF359: Atty Erdman requests additional PSC. Court sets PSC. Adjourned. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brittany Lynn Stripling in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. Defendant understands. Enter NG plea. Court sets PTC. ADA Becker states test results have not been received.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:33 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Defendant Brittany Lynn Stripling in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. S/T Investigator Dustin Geisness, SCSO; direct by Atty Rockow. Record reflects identity of DE. Cross by Atty Erdman. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Rockow notes Information will match the complaint. DE would like to do ARGN at a different time. Court will reset ARGN if Atty Erdman's trial goes. Bond continues, if hold is released, DE to be in court 8/11. Adjourned: 9:42 am
Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

for continuance of 6/16 PH. Filed by PD's Office. km

Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

CO: RMW , REP: Kathy Malsom via zoom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brittany Lynn Stripling appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Atty Dippolito waives further reading. Qualifies for PD services. ADA Rockow states DE is currently on a PO HOLD. Atty Harrelson will be appointed on this case. Requesting a preliminary hearing. Court schedules.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
